title: 114_hr2690
content: The Act titled "Including Families in Mental Health Recovery Act of 2015" clarifies circumstances for disclosing protected health information of mental illness patients under the HITECH Act. It adds improved privacy and security provisions for mental illness patients. The Secretary will issue regulations within a year of the Including Families in Mental Health Recovery Act of 2015, clarifying when health care providers can disclose protected health information of mental illness patients to communicate with family, caregivers, and others involved in the patient's care. The regulations will clarify when health care providers can disclose protected health information of mental illness patients to communicate with family, caregivers, and others involved in the patient's care, including considerations for patient consent and capacity. The regulations address communication with family members, caregivers, and law enforcement regarding mental illness patients' treatment, adherence to medication, and potential harm to self or others. Coordination with the Office for Civil Rights is required. The Secretary will ensure that regulations are consistent with the HIPAA Privacy Rule and Sharing Information Related to Mental Health guidance issued by the Department of Health and Human Services on February 20, 2014. SEC. 3. DEVELOPMENT AND DISSEMINATION OF MODEL TRAINING PROGRAMS. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will develop and distribute a model program and materials for training healthcare providers on the circumstances for disclosing protected health information of patients with mental illness. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will develop model programs and materials for training healthcare providers, lawyers, patients, and families on disclosing protected health information of patients with mental illness. Periodic updates will be made to the programs and materials, which will address the HIPAA Privacy Rule and Sharing Information Related to Mental Health guidance issued by the Department of Health and Human Services. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will coordinate with relevant agencies to develop model programs and materials for disclosing protected health information of patients with mental illness. Input will be solicited from national, State, and local associations, and funding of $5,000,000 for fiscal year 2016 and $25,000,000 for fiscal years 2017 through 2022 is authorized.
